verses.roman:
sūtrera pariṇāma-vāda, tāhā nā māniyā
'vivarta-vāda' sthāpe, 'vyāsa bhrānta' baliyā

synonyms: sūtrera—of the codes of the Vedānta-sūtra; pariṇāma-vāda—the transformation of energy; tāhā nā māniyā—not accepting this fact; vivarta-vāda—the theory of illusion; sthāpe—establishes; vyāsa bhrānta baliyā—accusing Vyāsadeva to be mistaken.
translation: "Not accepting the transformation of energy, Śrīpād Śaṅkarācārya has tried to establish the theory of illusion under the plea that Vyāsadeva has made a mistake.

purport.content: For a further explanation of this verse, one may refer to Chapter Seven (verses 121-126).
